metadata.title: USN-6772-1 -- strongSwan vulnerability
metadata.description: Jan Schermer discovered that strongSwan incorrectly validated client certificates in certain configurations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass access controls.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6772-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  charon-cmd - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 charon-systemd - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 libcharon-extauth-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 libstrongswan - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 strongswan - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 strongswan-charon - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 strongswan-libcharon - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 strongswan-nm - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 strongswan-pki - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 strongswan-scepclient - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 strongswan-starter - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 strongswan-swanctl - 5.9.5-2ubuntu2.3 No subscription required
